newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castorseed prices rise on Chinese interest.
newsitem.headline: Indian castorseed prices rise on Chinese interest.

text.p: Indian castorseed September delivery prices on Friday rose to to 1,154/1,155 rupees per quintal from 1,145 rupees on interest from Chinese buyers, dealers said.
Sliding arrivals of castorseed in the producing centres as well as fresh enquiries from Chinese buyers prompted bull buying while bears were covering positions.
"Some Chinese buyers are now visiting producing centres in the Gujarat region and marketmen were hopeful of a Chinese demand," one operator said.

Groundnut oil rose by 2/3 rupees at 364/365 rupees per 10 kg on fresh consumer buying while summer crop arrivals remained lower than expected as recent unseasonal rain in producing centres had affected crushing operations at mills.

"Imported palm oil also moved up from 270 rupees to 272 rupees per 10 kg amid absence of fresh arrivals at Bombay port coupled with fresh outstation buying which helped prices to bounce back after recent losses," one broker said.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was steady at 570 rupees per 15 kg.
